name: Loan
label: loan
definition: debt instrument whereby one party extends money or credit to another party (or parties) with the understanding that the borrowed money will be repaid according to the terms of the contract

name: LoanSpecificCustomerAccount
definition: account held by the borrower associated with a specific loan
label: loan-specific customer account

name: LoanPaymentSchedule
explanatoryNote: Loan payment schedules may or may not be amortization schedules, i.e., they may or may not include principal.
label: loan payment schedule
definition: regular or explicit (ad hoc) payment schedule associated with a given loan-specific account

name: GuaranteedLoan
definition: loan that is secured with respect to repayment of principal and interest by guaranty
label: guaranteed loan
explanatoryNote: A loan guarantee is a promise by one party to assume the debt obligation of a borrower if that borrower defaults. A guarantee can be limited or unlimited, making the guarantor liable for only a portion or all of the debt.

name: SecuredLoan
label: secured loan
definition: loan in which the borrower pledges some asset via a security agreement as collateral for the loan, or that is secured via third-party guarantee

name: LoanToValueRatio
label: loan-to-value ratio
definition: ratio, expressed as a percentage, between the principal amount of the loan and the appraised value of the asset securing the financing

name: IndividualPaymentTransaction
label: individual payment transaction
definition: actual payment of principal, interest, fees, or other related amounts towards fulfillment of a debt obligation

name: ClosedEndCredit
label: closed-end credit
definition: credit agreement in which the loan principal cannot be increased after funds are dispersed in full when the loan closes
explanatoryNote: The loan may require regular payments that pay down principal periodically, or it may require the full payment of principal at maturity.

name: PrepaymentTerms
label: pre-payment terms
definition: principal repayment terms related to payment of the loan prior to maturity
explanatoryNote: Prepayment may or may not involve refinancing with the same lender. Prepayment terms include any prepayment penalty period, penalty amount and whether or not there is provision for waiver of the penalty, and any conditions related to making additional payments or payments over and above the expected installment payment over the lifetime of the loan.

name: CombinedLoanToValueRatio
label: combined loan-to-value ratio
explanatoryNote: This is particularly important for secondary loans, or for refinancing that combines outstanding loans against a given asset. Lenders use this ratio to evaluate the risk of extending a loan to a borrower(s) in cases where multiple loans are involved.
definition: ratio of the total amount of debt that is secured by the asset(s) and the appraised value of the asset(s) securing the financing

name: PaymentHistory
definition: record of actual payments of principal, interest, and other related amounts made by a borrower to a lender or servicer in order to fulfill their re-payment obligation
label: payment history

name: LenderLienPosition
label: lender lien position
definition: classifier indicating whether the lender has the primary lien position with respect to an asset used as collateral for the loan

name: OpenEndCredit
explanatoryNote: There is a credit limit most of the time, with exceptions including reverse mortgages with tenure payment. The borrower has the option of paying off the outstanding balance, without penalty, or making installment payments.
definition: credit agreement that may be extended up to an agreed credit limit and paid down at any time within the period of the line, if any, and on which interest is charged only on the outstanding balance
label: open-end credit

name: CollateralizedLoan
label: collateralized loan
definition: secured loan that is secured with cash or other acceptable collateral (real property, securities or other assets) provided by the borrower as specified in the collateral agreement

name: OwnershipInterest
label: ownership interest
definition: classifier indicating the nature of the applicant's or borrower's ownership or leasehold interest in an asset used as collateral for the loan

name: Servicer
label: servicer
explanatoryNote: In cases where a loan has been securitized, the servicer is also responsible for forwarding payments to investors, filing reports with credit-rating agencies and investors, and so forth.
definition: party that collects principal and interest payments on behalf of the lender

name: TotalOutstandingPrincipal
label: total outstanding principal
definition: the principal balance of all loans secured by the property

name: UnsecuredLoan
definition: loan granted based on the strength of the borrower's credit history or reputation in the community
label: unsecured loan

name: Comaker
definition: party that signs a borrower's promissory note, providing additional security and potentially improving the quality of the debt
explanatoryNote: The co-maker's liability is similar to that of an endorser or guarantor, but with additional risk/exposure, as they can be compelled to honor the debt much sooner and regardless of whether certain conditions are met.
label: co-maker

name: FractionalOwnershipInterest
definition: classification indicating that several parties may share in, and mitigate the risk of, ownership of a high-value tangible asset
label: fractional ownership interest

name: isInitiallyPayable
label: is initially payable
definition: indicates whether the obligation arising from the covered loan was, or in the case of an application, would have been initially payable to the financial institution

name: hasCreditLimit
label: has credit limit
definition: specifies the maximum amount of funds that may be borrowed (e.g. for line of credit)

name: hasScheduledUnpaidBalance
definition: indicates what the balance should be after a scheduled payment is made according to contract terms
label: has scheduled unpaid balance

name: FeeSimpleOwnershipInterest
explanatoryNote: Fee simple is the term used to represent the maximum ownership interest in real property that is allowed under the law. It can be referred to as 'complete ownership'.
definition: classification indicating the most common type of ownership, covering an indefinite ownership period and the freedom to transfer said ownership as desired
label: fee-simple ownership interest

name: hasTotalClosingCosts
definition: indicates the total the amount paid at the closing of a real estate transaction, i.e., at the time when the title to the property is conveyed (transferred) to the buyer
explanatoryNote: Closing costs may be incurred by either the buyer or the seller, and may include fees paid by either or both parties for the preparation and recording of documents, title service costs, such as for title search and insurance (typically paid by the seller, depending on the jurisdiction), other recording costs, other document or transaction stamps or taxes, brokerage commissions, survey, appraisal, inspection and other such fees, home warranties, private mortgage insurance (PMI), and so forth.
label: has total closing costs

name: isAssumable
label: is assumable
definition: indicates whether or not another borrower may assume the payments on this loan

name: hasIndividualPayment
label: has individual payment
definition: links an actual payment of principal, interest, and other related amounts to the overall payment history for an account

name: hasPaymentHistory
definition: relates a credit agreement, loan, or commitment to any history of payments that have been made by the borrower up to the point that payment history is requested
label: has payment history

name: hasBalloonPayment
label: has balloon payment
definition: indicates whether the contractual terms include or would have included repayment of the outstanding principal sum at the end of a loan period, prior to which only partial or no payments were made on the principal

name: hasPrePaymentPenaltyTerm
label: has pre-payment penalty term
definition: relates a loan to a period of time in months after which there is no prepayment penalty

name: hasNegativeAmortization
label: has negative amortization
definition: indicates whether the contractual terms include or would have included a feature that allows unpaid interest to be added to the balance of unpaid principal

name: hasCost
definition: has amount payable for principal, interest, fees or other expenses
label: has cost
explanatoryNote: This can entail adding up other prices and/or fees (e.g. 4 units * a unit price)

name: PrimaryLienPosition
label: primary lien position
definition: first position in the order of seniority in which the law recognizes lenders' claims against a property

name: isInterestOnly
definition: indicates whether the contractual terms include or would have included interest only payments
label: is interest only

name: hasLoanBalance
label: has loan balance
definition: indicates the balance with respect to the principal on the loan as of some date

name: hasPrincipalAmount
definition: indicates the nominal amount of the loan that must be paid at or before maturity
label: has principal amount

name: hasFirstRateChangeTerm
label: has first rate change term
definition: specifies a period of time in months after origination during which the interest rate cannot change

name: isServicedBy
label: is performed by
definition: relates a loan to the financial service provider that services it

name: SubordinateLienPosition
label: subordinate lien position
definition: secondary or lower position in the order of seniority in which the law recognizes lenders' claims against a property

name: hasTotalPointsAndFees
definition: indicates a form of pre-paid interest, charged by the lender as an alternative to charging a higher rate of interest on the mortgage loan
explanatoryNote: One point equals one percent of the loan principal, and usually reduces the interest rate by 1/8 percent (0.125)
label: has total points and fees
